Hi! I'm an epidemiologist by training, interested in quantifying environment-health interactions and working with data in any setting. I currently work as a Programmer Analyst at Weill Cornell Medicine in New York City. 

I hold a master's degree from Columbia University's Departments of [Epidemiology](https://www.mailman.columbia.edu/academics/departments/epidemiology) and [Biostatistics](https://www.mailman.columbia.edu/academics/departments/biostatistics). I continue to collaborate with researchers at Columbia and the National Birth Defects Prevention Study ([NBDPS](https://www.cdc.gov/ncbddd/birthdefects/nbdps.html)).
